result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald D Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ronald D Wilson appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald D Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defense requests an adjournment as they are still awaiting additional discovery to be received. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ronald D Wilson appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Ronald D Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and needs time to review with client.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/18/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Best Buy Wauwatosa.

Defendant Ronald D Wilson in court.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/16/2022@2p
